characters: THE TOWER BELL TOLLS THE HOUR...
THREE BEATS OF DARKNESS MAKE US THINK OUR STORY HAS ENDED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sunlight gleams off the great IRON CAST BELL as it continues ringing, but at its normal speed. From this high up we can see how isolated the school is - surrounded on one side by thick forest. A small campus, mostly brick and ivy. In the Quad, a fraction of the students amble to their classes. We glimpse the highlights: THE FOOTBALL FIELD. SORORITY ROW. AN ADMINISTRATIVE BUILDING. THE DORMS. INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING A boxed shrine to hip. From the “BLADE RUNNER” and vintage “STAR WARS” posters to the book shelf lined with plastic-sealed comics. Tangled in black skull and crossbone sheets, we find TERESA “Tree” GELBMAN, 19, beautiful. Outside, the bell tolls one final time before a calm settles over the room. The quiet doesn’t last long as Tree’s CELL PHONE plays “Happy Birthday”. Tree stirs through the fog of her hang-over, searching for her phone. As she sits up, several things hit her at once: she’s not in her room, she's wearing a guy's T- shirt, and the guy it probably belongs to is bent down, putting something away under the couch. CARTER DAVIS, 19, good looks hidden behind grunge and stubble, turns around and smiles at Tree.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You’re up. I wasn’t --

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Where are my clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the night stand. Tree fishes her phone out -- 1 missed call from “DAD”. She snaps it shut with an exasperated sigh. Tree pulls off the T-shirt, exposing a black lace bra. Carter quickly turns his back to her. CARTER (CONT’D) I don’t know if you remember my name. You were pretty wasted last night. I’m Car--

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Tylenol?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: My head’s killing me. Do you have any Tylenol?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh, sure. Hold on a sec. He starts rummaging through the debris of his room while Tree finishes getting dressed. Carter finds a bottle of aspirin in a TOILETRY BAG that was hidden under a pair of jeans. He offers her a pill. She snatches the bottle and dumps three in her hand and dry-swallows them like a pro.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m Carter.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (interrupting again) Not a word of this to anyone. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sure... Tree starts to leave. The door is covered in a collage of band stickers and other bits and strips of randomness. In the middle of it all is a BUMPER STICKER that proclaims: “TODAY IS THE FIRST DAY OF THE REST OF YOUR LIFE” Tree opens the door and collides with a lanky FRESHMAN. The words are already leaving his mouth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! Did you hit that fine-vagine or what?! He meets Tree’s hard stare and instantly shrinks. Tree pushes past him. Carter shoots the freshman a look.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Nice one, dickweed. Carter’s eyes fall on Tree’s GOLD BRACELET, lying on the floor, as it catches the light from the open window. She must have knocked it off the night stand in her haste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in a slinky outfit and heels, Tree is forced to make the “walk of shame” across the already bustling campus. She shields her eyes from the blinding sunlight. She passes a female STUDENT who thrusts a petition at her.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Stop global warming! Tree doesn’t deign to acknowledge the proffered clipboard. A nearby CAR ALARM goes off. Next, Tree notices a PAIR OF STUDENTS studying on the lawn as the sprinklers suddenly go off -- they’re getting soaked as they scramble to protect their books. On the left, TREE passes a group of FRAT PLEDGES singing loudly. THE FRAT BROTHER stands beside a sign: “26th Straight Hour”.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT PLEDGES
dialogues.text: -- not a Willie or a Sam! I’m the eighth ole’ man named Henry! Henry the Eighth, I am!

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BROTHER
dialogues.text: Second verse, same as the first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Henry the Eighth, I am, I am!... The crowd of onlookers cheer as one EXHAUSTED FRAT PLEDGE passes out, hitting his head hard on the pavement. Tree reaches the end of the quad and starts down the steps, as KEITH LUMBLY (18, a big-boned mouthbreather) is just lumbering up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Morning Tree! She genuinely doesn’t see him... He sighs. The end of the steps lead to SORORITY ROW. Tree’s house, KAPPA DELTA is a converted Mansion at the edge of the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree creeps into the house -- trying to avoid any of her sisters. She’s got one foot on the stairs when:

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Oh-my-god. You sneaky beeyotch! Busted. Tree turns around to face DANIELLE BOUSEMAN, 20, peroxide-pretty.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLLE
dialogues.text: Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLLE
dialogues.text: Sisters don’t keep secrets.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Seriously. It was nobody.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLLE
dialogues.text: Well, I hope nobody used a condom. We don’t want somebody getting chlamydia.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Thanks for that, Danielle. Really, so thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are sisters for? Tree starts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLLE
dialogues.text: (calling after her) Don’t forget! House meeting at lunch!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Living for it! INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - MORNING Tree has changed into new clothes and is running a brush through her tangled bed-head when her roommate, LORI SPENGLER (18, a cherubic faced redhead) steps from the bathroom, wet, wrapped in a towel.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: She finally rolls in. Shoving a pile of “rejected outfits” off her bed, Tree curls up with her childhood stuffed animal.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Did I totally embarrass myself last night?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Not at all. Unless you consider dancing on a table, starting two fights, and barfing pretzel chunks all over the bar embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Please tell me you’re kidding...

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Oh, and you rammed your tongue down Nick Sims’ throat right in front of Danielle.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: For shizzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she was so nice to me this morning?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I think she was as drunk as you last night. Consider it collective amnesia.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Thank god for that. Tree looks at the clock.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crap! I’m so late for class! Tree starts putting her backpack together. Her side of the room is a giant mess -- clothes, make-up, and trash strewn everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t find my damn book!

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Maybe if you cleaned your side of the room, you could actually find something.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Just cause I’m not an OCD freak -- (finding her book) Ha! The TEXT BOOK is under a pile of mail on her desk. (Note: there’s a BLACK ENVELOPE on top of the pile but Tree pays it no attention.) Lori clears her throat behind Tree -- Tree turns around and discovers her roommate holding a CUPCAKE with a single, burning candle.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Did you really think you could keep it a secret from me?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: How did you find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver’s license. Not the best picture of you, I might add.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I assume you changed my ringer too?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: (sly) Who me? Never. Tree reluctantly takes the cupcake. Closing her eyes, she makes a wish and blows the candle out.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’d you wish for?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: A new roommate.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: (laughing) Wench. And without a second thought, Tree dumps the cupcake into the trash.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Too many carbs. Lori looks a little hurt. Tree grabs her bag.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toodles.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Well, you’re welcome... Tree’s already out the door. Lori shakes her head: Tree thoughtlessly left the door open with Lori still standing there in the towel.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? Towel here -- !  INT. DR. BUTLER’S SCIENCE CLASS - MORNING Tree “sneaks” into the rear of the lecture hall. DR. GREGORY BUTLER (early 30’s, chiseled) jots notes on the chalkboard.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: When extreme agitation occurs, locomotive response in the subjects show an acceleration across the quantum plane, where -- A quiet entrance is ruined by a very loud, squeaky door as Tree slinks into the room. As she takes a seat in the back she makes eye-contact with her professor. Was that a sneer or a smirk he just flashed her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of Kappa girls have gathered around a table, as Danielle conducts a house meeting with the intensity of a U.N. assembly. To her right, MONICA KEENER, 18, a nervous pledge, diligently takes notes on a legal pad. The other girls, including Tree, absently suck on sugar- free, no whip Mochas OR what they call...lunch. Visibly absent is Lori.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: -- and we still need to pick this year’s charity. I can say right now, there is no way we're doing the Special Needs art fair again. All those tards want to do is hug. Totally freaked my shit out. Thoughts? Another pledge, BECKY SHEPARD, 18, a little chunky but doing her best to fit-in, joins the group with her tray. All eyes fall on her food...a sandwich with a side of pasta salad, and a tall glass of chocolate milk. Feeling the weight of their collective stares:

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. What’s wrong Tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Except for the buffet you just dumped on our table.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: And is that chocolate milk I see? Becky looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (ashamed) I missed breakfast. She gets up with her tray and SLAMS into Carter. The chocolate milk slides off the tray and SPLASHES all over Tree. Danielle cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Ass-- She looks up and sees who it is.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --hole. Carter grabs some napkins from the dispenser on the table.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Tree.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: You two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER TREE
dialogues.text: Yes. No. They look at each other -- Tree’s eyes could burn holes through him. Carter remembers her threat earlier.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (sheepish) We...had a class together last year. Tree snatches the napkins from him and starts wiping herself down. CARTER (CONT’D) I just came by to return this.  10. He offers Tree her bracelet. CARTER (CONT’D) I didn’t know where you lived-- Tree snatches it back and looks around to see if anybody saw the exchange. Luckily, they didn’t. He waits for a “thank you”.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Help you? Carter’s hurt turns to indignation. But he doesn’t bark at her. He’s better than that.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sorry again about the mess. Carter walks off.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: What a douche-bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree, a BLUE WORK SMOCK over the CHOCOLATE MILK STAIN on her blouse thumbs through a copy of US Weekly. Her boss, LEONARD GILBERT, 40's, wormy, peers over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: Teresa, I believe you’re supposed to be unpacking the new shipment, not reading about-- (reading the cover) --Brangelina.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m still on my ten.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: Your ten ended ten minutes ago, missy. Tree drops the magazine. As she heads toward the back, she passes a display of school-spirit paraphernalia including a stack of eerie MASKS (the school mascot).  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluorescent lights HUM in the sterile room as we find Tree hunched over a pile of text books, stamping the covers with STICKERS that say “REDUCED”. Immersed in the mind-blowing monotony of her job, Tree doesn’t see the HULKING FIGURE standing behind her. We SEE a BOX CUTTER in his dirty hand as the blade slowly slides out... The figure leans in and SLASHES!-- --the plastic band wrapped around a pile of books next to Tree. She jumps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith (the mouthbreather from before) standing behind Tree.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Don’t sneak up on me, Keith. It’s creepy.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Leonard wants to know if the books are ready. Tree picks up a stack and shoves them into Keith’s arms. But he doesn’t move. He just stands there like a lug, holding the stack.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Anything else, Keith?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Um...I was wondering what you were doing this Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Are you asking me on a date, Keith? His cheeks turn red.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Well...sorta...  12. Tree raises the gun and STAMPS Keith’s forehead with a “REDUCED” sticker.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Sorry, I’m busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree enters the lobby. Her cell phone plays “Happy Birthday”. Tree checks the LCD: INCOMING CALL FROM DAD. She instantly hits the IGNORE button as she stops in front of the elevators. The doors open -- LORI steps out, wearing her NURSING SCRUBS.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (surprised) Lori...

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Hi. She steps out. The doors close as Tree struggles with the stilted air between them.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: So, I thought you only work nights.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I’m doing a double for Jen. She has the flu.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: We missed you at the meeting today.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I didn’t think I needed to be there to decide what color Danielle’s hair should be this season. Tree laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess I don’t have to ask what you're doing here. The levity between them dissolves instantly.  13.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Gotta go. Nudging past Lori, Tree presses elevator button.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Look, Tree...it’s none of my business but I think eventually something like that is bound to have some pretty serious consequences. The doors open. Tree steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You're right. It’s none of your business. The metal doors shut -- Lori’s disconcerted expression reflected in the polished surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree exits the elevator and discreetly slips past the nurse’s station and disappears behind a door marked “DR. GREGORY BUTLER” As the door closes, we SEE a POLICE OFFICER stationed outside a door at the far end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree pushes open the door of this small cramped office and realizes she’s alone for a moment. She notices a wedding picture of a happy bride and groom. She smirks, places it face side down on the desk. Gregory (Professor Butler) enters his office, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: We can’t do this. There’s too much going on in the building today.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Okay. I'’11 go. She takes his CAR KEYS out of his hand and dumps them in his desk drawer.  14.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: I have patients...

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I’m losing mine. ZIP! She has her hands down his pants, kissing him hard.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: (between kisses) This doesn’t mean you’re passing my course.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Do I look like I care? They start kissing passionately -- Tree accidentally kicks the desk chair across the room. It wedges itself between the door and a file cabinet. Which is perfect, as, suddenly... SOMEONE OUTSIDE opens the door and tries to enter, but it is jammed.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Gregory? Are you there? In what seems like an instant later... ... Gregory and a completely dressed Tree open the door for STEPHANIE BUTLER (pretty, fragile) Gregory’s wife.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Hey, Sweetie -- He gives Stephanie a kiss. GREGORY (CONT’D) -- just wrapping up here. Tree squeezes past Stephanie and forces a smile -- which isn’t returned. As Gregory closes the door, Stephanie glances back at Tree, who wonders if Stephanie suspects anything. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - EVENING Tree sits on her bed, painting her toenails while a “Road Rules” marathon runs for the umpteenth time on MTV. There’s a light knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter... Danielle walks in, all dolled-up. Tree sizes furrowed.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that my top?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: How cute is it on me?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Just don’t get anything on it, please.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: You mean like Nick’s jizz?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Wow. Classy.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: (ignoring her) What time are you going to the party tonight?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I don’t know...later. Tree goes back to painting her nails. Just then, there is a BLACK OUT. It is 9:23.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Our tuition dollars at work. A moment later, the lights go back on. DANIELLE (CONT’D) Anyhoo...don’t be too late or all the cute Sigma boys will be taken. Danielle leaves. Looking down, Tree notices she messed up one in the blackout. Tree growls. As she reaches the bottle of POLISH REMOVER, she spills the of RED NAIL POLISH on her bedspread. 15. her up, brow of her toes over to grab open bottle  16.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Damn it! Tree jumps up and grabs a crumpled towel hanging over her desk chair. But something makes her freeze... A PHOTOGRAPH... Peeking out beneath her unopened mail (and the BLACK CARD). She picks up the photo. We SEE Tree, dressed in her high school cap and gown, framed between her proud FATHER and MOTHER (Tree looks just like her). The image cuts right to Tree’s heart -- so Tree does the only thing she knows, she hides the photo in the top drawer of the dresser. Out of sight, out of mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree, in a resplendent white cotton dress, leaves her house and looks around. The area is completely empty of people. Most everyone at their respective pledge houses. Tree checks her VOICE MAIL as she walks at a brisk clip.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hey, it's me. I'll text you later about meeting tonight. Not sure if I can get away but I'll do my best. By the way, that was close this afternoon. But kinda hot. Tree laughs. SAVE -- NEXT MESSAGE...

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (pissed) Tree, it's dad. I sat in that restaurant waiting for you for almost an hour -- DELETE. Tree snaps her phone shut. At the path she comes upon a blocked off area. She glances at her watch. 10:43.  17.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Shit. The lights are off along the cordoned and torn up path. But it is the shortest way to the Quad. Tree steps around the wooden barriers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree walks along the path, suddenly aware of... what? Something? Someone?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Hello? She comes across a large ditch exposing a water pipe. She realizes she has to edge around, towards the trees. Taking a deep breath, convinced she is alone, she edges her way along the ditch. Her back to the trees. Which is when a hand reaches out from the shadows and grabs her around the mouth! Her muffled screams are cut short when she’s suddenly aware of the KNIFE that erupts from her chest! Before she can make sense of it... She’s tossed in the ditch... ..-where her rapidly draining blood mixes with the water and mud. She stares wide-eyed at an uncaring universe. Then she is dead.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM CUT
dialogues.text: INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING Tree bolts awake -- realizing it was just a nightmare, she inhales deeply with relief. In the background we HEAR the bell toll the hour. Suddenly her cell phone rings...”Happy Birthday” plays. Sitting up, Tree finds Carter bent over, putting something away beneath the sofa. He turns around, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You’re up. I wasn’t --  18.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) My clothes?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh...on the night stand. Tree fishes her phone out of her jeans -- 1 missed call from “DAD”. She snaps the phone shut. Tree starts changing into her clothes. Carter turns around. CARTER (CONT’D) I don’t know if you remember my name. You were pretty wasted last night. I’m Car--

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Carter. He smiles, pleasantly surprised.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tylenol?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: My head’s killing me. Do you have any Tylenol?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh, sure. Hold on a sec. Carter begins searching. Tree grows inpatient and grabs his TOILETRY BAG under some clothes. She finds the bottle and dumps the pills in her hand. CARTER (CONT’D) (laughing) Wow. Have you been here before? The question makes Tree pause. How did she know where the aspirin was? CARTER (CONT’D) You okay?  19. Tree is still thinking.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tree? She turns and looks at his door -- there’s the sticker: “TODAY IS THE FIRST DAY OF THE REST OF YOUR LIFE” Suddenly, the door opens. Enter lanky freshman...

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN
dialogues.text: Dude! Did you hit that fine-vagine or what?! He immediately shrinks at the sight of her. A little freaked, Tree pushes past him and hurries out. Carter shoots the freshman a look.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Nice one, dickweed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shielding her eyes from the glaring sun, Tree makes the “walk of shame” again. But it’s all so familiar. She passes the student protester.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Stop global warming! The CAR ALARM goes off... Then the sprinklers, soaking the studying pair. The frat pledges...

dialogues.speaker: FRAT PLEDGES
dialogues.text: -- not a Willie or a Sam! I’m the eighth ole’ man named Henry! Henry the Eighth, I am!

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BROTHER
dialogues.text: Second verse, same as the first!

dialogues.speaker: FRAT PLEDGES
dialogues.text: Oh, Henry the Eighth, I am, I am!... Keith, waiting for Tree at the steps...  20.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Morning Tree. This time, she notices him.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Keith, what day is it?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Tuesday, the eighteenth.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Says so right here on my watch. He offers his wrist but Tree turns and looks back. The whole world looks a little off kilter to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree doesn’t sneak in this time. But as she starts up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Oh-my-god. You sneaky beeyotch! Tree turns around, clearly on edge. DANIELLE (CONT’D) Who was it? (off Tree’s blank stare/offended) Sisters don’t keep secrets.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No, I’m totally having deja vu right now.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I have it all the time. It’s supposed to mean somebody’s like walking over your grave or something.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Seriously. I’ve had it all morning. It’s crazy.  21.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Maybe you should switch to water next time, hon. You’re so Tara Reid when you drink.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Thanks. I’1l keep that in mind.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: What are sisters for? Tree starts up the stairs. DANIELLE (CONT’D) (calling after her) Don’t forget! House meeting at lunch! Tree stops again, turns around. Danielle misinterprets the confused look in her eyes. DANIELLE (CONT’D) It’s been on the schedule board since last Thursday, Tree.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yeah...I remember. The problem is she remembers everything. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - MORNING Tree is changing when Lori steps from the bathroom, wrapped in a towel.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: She finally rolls-in. Tree just stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were sort of a mess last night.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Dancing on a table, barfing pretzel chunks?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You remember. I’m shocked.  22.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (re: the deja vu) So weird.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Oh, and you rammed your tongue down Nick Sims’ throat right in front of Danielle.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I‘'m...late for class. Grabbing her backpack, Tree immediately finds her book on the desk. When she looks up, Lori has the cupcake.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Did you really think you could keep it a secret from me? She hands the cupcake to Tree who is still totally tripping.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you wanna know how I found out?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You looked at my driver's license.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Well, aren’t you the clever one.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Tree sets the cupcake down.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: But you didn’t even blow the candle out. She’s gone, pulling the door shut behind her. The wind BLOWS the candle out anyway. Confused by Tree’s odd demeanor, Lori looks down at the cupcake. CLOSE ON... The candle...a sinewy rope of smoke rising from the extinguished wick.  23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Delta’s are around the table as before. Tree is spacing out as Danielle holds court.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: -- and we still need to pick this year’s charity. I can say right now, there is no way we're doing the Special Needs art fair again. All those tards want to do is hug. Totally freaked my shit out. Thoughts? Becky arrives with her lunch tray.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. What’s wrong Tree? Tree suddenly looks up -- she only caught the tail-end of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m just a little tired, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: No, dumb-ass. What’s wrong with that? She points at Becky’s food. Tree shakes her head. DANIELLE (CONT’D) So not Kappa-cuisine. And is that chocolate milk I see?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (ashamed) I missed breakfast. Humiliated, Becky stands with her tray, she starts to turn...

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Becky, look out! SLAM! Becky collides with Carter. The chocolate milk splashes all over Tree. Danielle cracks up. Carter grabs some napkins from the dispenser on the table.  24.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Tree.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: You two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: TREE CARTER
dialogues.text: No. Yes. Tree slowly turns and looks at Carter -- he sees the fear in her eyes. Translates it quickly:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We...had a class together last year. (to Tree) Sorry again. He starts to walk off.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Hey! He stops turns around. Tree walks up to him -- clears her throat awkwardly. Carter stares at her like she’s crazy until he looks down and sees her open hand.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My bracelet?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Here-- Reaching into his pocket, he drops it into the palm of her hand. For a split-second Tree pauses -- how did she know he had it on him? Tree finally turns around and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: What a douche-bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree, her blue smock covers her chocolate milk stain, thumbs through her US Weekly... her brow is furrowed, this is all so fucking familiar to her. It is irritating. She suddenly recalls Leonard approaching. Tree quickly hides the magazine and pretends to be pricing down some dictionaries with a red pen. He eyes her suspiciously.  25.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (duh? ) Working.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: I believe you’re supposed to be unpacking the new shipment, not pricing dictionaries. Tree drops the marker and gets up. As she heads toward the back, she passes the display of school spirit paraphernalia. She freezes -- --and picks something up we don’t see. Trees looks like she’s just seen a ghost. Her own. Off screen, there’s a loud BANG! Tree looks to her right where Keith has just dropped something. He looks at Tree. There’s something peculiar in his eyes. Tree hurries past the stock room door. Keith moves to the display and studies what Tree just set down... A MASK. Keith’s big, meaty hand curls around the mask as he slowly brings it to his face -- his breathing even louder behind the eerie plastic grin. There’s a FULL-LENGTH MIRROR to his right -- Keith twists his head to the right and meets his masked reflection. Off his silent stare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree enters the lobby. Her cell phone plays “Happy Birthday”. Tree checks the LCD: INCOMING CALL FROM DAD. She instantly hits the IGNORE button as she stops in front of the elevators. The doors open as LORI steps out, wearing her NURSING SCRUBS.  26.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (surprised) Lori...

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Hi. She steps out. This time Tree steps into the elevator. The doors start to close but Lori’s hand catches the bumper. The doors open.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You were acting really weird this morning.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m having a weird day.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Look, it’s none of my business but I think eventually something like that is bound to have some pretty serious consequences.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Lori, I really can’t talk right now.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Fine...it’s your life. Lori pulls her hand back, letting the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Tree turns over the wedding photo without looking at it. She pushes the photo under some papers. Gregory enters, and quickly closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: We can’t do this. There’s too much going on in the building today.  27.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you. She reaches around him... to LOCK THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Tree, I know what you’re going to say.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You do? Gregory puts his CAR KEYS in his desk.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: It’s normal for a young girl to have feelings for an older man. But you can’t let it cross that line. You can’t fall in love.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m not falling in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: (relieved) You’re not?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No. I’ve been having-- Overcome with lust at her proximity, Gregory lifts her to his desk and starts to kiss her -- Tree resists but he’s not stopping. Tree is overcome by a sudden sense of dread. She pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (breathless) Your...wife? He stops.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Okay. That’s kind of a buzz kill. A jangling of the doorknob. And then a loud knocking!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gregory? Are you in there?  28.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: (hushed) Thank god you locked the door! Tree and Gregory hurriedly adjust their clothing and open the door -- Gregory giving a lame: GREGORY (CONT’D) Didn‘t realize I locked the door. Have you met my student Teresa?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No, I don’t think I have.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Hi. Tree edges past. Stephanie gives Gregory a look regarding Tree: What was that about...? Gregory gives the loopdy- loop international sign for Parts On Order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading toward the elevator, Tree passes the nurse’s station and overhears a couple NURSES whispering.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Well, I’m not comfortable with it.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Me neither. They both look up at Tree at the same time. Tree’s immediate thought...Do they know about her and Gregory? Diverting her eyes, Tree reaches the elevators. While she waits, she notices the POLICE OFFICER sitting at the end of the hall. Was he in her “dream”? (YES) INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT “Road Rules” is on the TV. Tree is at her dresser, looking at the same picture from her high school graduation. There’s a knock at the door... Tree stuffs the photo into the top drawer as Danielle enters. She’s all dolled-up. Tree recognizes her top instantly. Reading Tree’s expression:  29.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: I know. I’m just borrowing it for tonight. How cute is it on me? Overwhelmed by her deja vu, Tree looks at the TV -- she recognizes the challenge on “Road Rules”. DANIELLE (0.C.) (CONT’D) What time are you going to the party tonight? (Tree doesn’t hear her) Hello?...earth to space-bitch... Tree snaps out of it.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: (pretending to use sign-language) What-time-are-you-going-to-the- party?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I don’t know...later. BLACKOUT.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god! The lights come back on.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Our tuition dollars at work. She sees the fear in Tree's eyes. DANIELLE (CONT’D) Chill out. It’s just another rolling blackout, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (hopeful) It happened before?  30.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, like two weeks ago. I remember because I was running on the treadmill and almost ate shit. I don’t know what’s so hard about keeping the electricity on. Anyhoo...don’t be too late or all the cute Sigma boys will be taken. She leaves. We HOLD ON Tree -- her face wrought with a mounting sense of dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree, in a resplendent white cotton dress, leaves her house and looks around. The area is completely empty of people. Most everyone at their respective pledge houses. Tree checks her VOICE MAIL as she walks at a brisk clip.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hey, it's me. I'll text you later about meeting tonight. Not sure if I can get away but I'll do my best. By the way, that was close this afternoon. But kinda hot. SAVE -- NEXT MESSAGE...

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (pissed) Tree, it's dad. I sat in that restaurant waiting for you for almost an hour -- DELETE. Tree snaps her phone shut. At the path she comes upon a blocked off area. A palpable dread washes over her. She glances at her watch. 10:43. The lights are off along the cordoned and torn up path. But it is the shortest way to the Quad.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (chiding herself) You’re being an idiot. It was just a dream.  31. Tree steps around the wooden barriers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks the path...skittish, but nope. Nothing. She comes across a ditch exposing a water pipe. She needs to edge around it, towards the trees. Off screen a branch SNAPS! Tree freezes...

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Hello? Somebody there? She looks around. All seems quiet and still until she catches something or someone move in her periphery.... Tree spins around. Just more space and the woods beyond...but Tree’s eyes zero-in on something peeking out from behind one of the trees... A FAINT GLIMMER OF LIGHT. LIKE THE TIP OF A KNIFE. Is somebody hiding behind the tree? Waiting?

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Screw this. Tree turns and runs back the way she came and practically leaps over the wooden barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurrying up the path, Tree reaches the front door and rings the bell. It’s oddly quiet for a usually racous place. Tree looks back over her shoulder to make sure she’s not being followed. When she turns back the door is already open. Tree’s POV -- -- THE MASK instantly appears out of the darkness! Tree SCREAMS and throws a right hook! BAM! The lights suddenly turn on revealing a CROWD gathered in the doorway.  32. There’s a big “HAPPY BIRTHDAY” banner hanging on the wall. Everyone is staring at Tree in shock. Somewhere in the back of the crowd, someone says:

dialogues.speaker: PERSON, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday? The guy who just got slugged, NICK SIMS (21, major hottie) pulls his mask off, rubbing his red and swelling cheek.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What the hell, Tree?!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Oh my god! I thought you -- I thought I was -- I’m so sorry. Danielle steps forward, addressing the crowd:

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Don’t mess with a Kappa bitch! The crowd cheers, bringing the levity back to the affair. Somebody CRANKS the music as Danielle pulls Tree into a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is in full swing. Empty plastic cups shake on the speakers pumping out some old school party anthem. Pushing through the throngs of REVELERS we find Tree in the corner with Danielle and some other randoms. Tree checks her cell phone -- no new messages. The disappointment registers on her face.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: (looking around) That slut.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Lori. She said she’d be here. She’s so out of the house next year.  33.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I think she had a double shift.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Whatevs. She’s been boning some mystery guy. Nick saddles up to Tree and offers her a beer.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Truce?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You know I didn’t mean it. Danielle tries to wedge herself between these two -- there’s lots of hair-flipping and eye-lash batting but it’s pretty obvious that Nick is more interested in Tree.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why were you wearing that stupid mask in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Big game’s on Friday. Just showing a little school spirit. Didn’t think I'd get clocked for it. Danielle laughs REALLY LOUD. It’s desperate and draws an annoyed look from Nick.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I really am sorry. Did you ice it?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s fine. (devilish grin) You can make it up to me later. He gives her a knowing wink before heading off into the crowd. Danielle looks like she’s going to kill Tree.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Don’t “what” me. You know exactly what you’re doing, Tree.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Danielle--  34. Danielle storms off in a huff. Tree’s CELL PHONE chimes. She looks at the screen. 1 NEW TEXT. It’s from Gregory: “Sorry...can’t get away tonight. C U tomorrow?” Hurt, Tree snaps the phone shut. Surrounded by people she hardly knows or hardly wants to know, Tree looks sad and alone. Tree starts pushing her way toward the front door when she sees something-- --Nick. Heading upstairs. He looks right at Tree and flashes a smile that says “follow me”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree reaches the top of the stairs, but Nick is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Nick? She starts down the hall. Tries the first door on her right. Tree’s POV -- THE BATHROOM. Two Kappa PARTY GIRLS (X-ing; eyes-wide, pupils totally dilated) are standing shoulder to shoulder at the sink. One of them is staring at herself in the mirror while the other pets a wash-cloth like it was her cat.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY GIRL
dialogues.text: (staring) I'm so pretty...

dialogues.speaker: PARTY GIRL
dialogues.text: (petting) It's so soft... They don’t even see Tree as she closes the door. A little further down the hall, Tree tries another door... Tree’s POV -- HALL CLOSET. A drunk COUPLE is getting it on. She quickly shuts the door.  35. The next door to her left is slightly ajar... INT. NICK’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Nick is sitting on the bed wearing the MASK.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You want me to hit you again? He stands and approaches her. Face to face, Tree laughs:

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m not into kinky. Lose the mask. She tries taking the mask off but he stops her with a GLOVED HAND.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s going on? She sees something over his shoulder...her eyes go WIDE with terror!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick’s semi-naked BODY lies on the closet floor. Blood pooling around him. Tree starts to scream as her KILLER grabs her throat! He pulls out a knife! Before he can stab her, she’s already swinging a FRATERNITY PADDLE she grabbed off the night stand!

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: The hard wood, cracks his arm, knocking the knife out of the killer’s grip -- it drops behind the headboard! Tree tries to go for the door but he blocks her!

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: SOMEBODY HELP ME
dialogues.text: The music and crowd-walla easily drown-out her cries for help. The killer grabs a HOCKEY STICK mounted on the wall as Tree backpedals toward the window. She pulls it half-way open when the killer takes a swing! Tree ducks!  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottom of the window frame as the hockey stick shears off the bottom of the wooden frame, exposing the jagged GLASS. Trying to squirm away, Tree loses her footing and falls back onto the window sill. The killer’s gloved hand pins her down! Looking up, Tree sees the sharp, exposed GLASS directly above her throat.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: The attacker grips the top of the frame and SLAMS the window shut!

dialogues.speaker: SLAM CUT
dialogues.text: INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING Tree wakes with a SCREAM. Clawing herself up into a seated position. Outside, the bell chimes the hour as Tree’s eyes dart around the room -- noting all the familiar bits and pieces.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: This can’t be happening...this can’t be real! Carter is staring back at Tree, mouth agape.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Everything. ..okay? Cue “Happy Birthday” from Trees cell phone. She grabs the phone from her clothes on the night stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INCOMING CALL FROM “DAD” On the brink of hysteria, Tree grabs her clothes and starts changing. Carter turns his back to her.  37. CARTER (CONT’D) I don’t know if you remember my name. You were --

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: --pretty wasted last night.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: And you’re name’s Carter?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (perking-up) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: But we’ve never met before?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not until last night. I mean, I’ve seen you around campus but we don’t exactly move in the same circles. Tree’s eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: This is a nightmare....

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (hurt/defensive) I’m sorry...but you’re the one who wanted to come here last night! Tree shoves him out of the way and runs for the door. She sees the sticker again.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Oh-my-god. Tree throws her weight into the door, as it swings open -

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Dude! Did you-- The door SMASHES the lanky kid in the face!

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow! Sonofa--  38. He sees Tree. Sees the tears running down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey. Tree pushes him out of the way and runs down the hall. The Freshman shoots Carter a look.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice one, dickweed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distraught Tree hurries through the bustling campus. She tries to side-steps the female PROTESTER who thrusts a petition at her.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Stop global warming! Tree slaps the clipboard away. STUDENT PROTESTER (CONT’D) (shouting after her) A simple “no-thanks” would do! Car alarm... Sprinklers... TREE passes a group of FRAT PLEDGES singing loudly. THE FRAT BROTHER stands beside a sign: “26th Straight Hour”.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT PLEDGES
dialogues.text: -- not a Willie or a Sam! I’m the eighth ole’ man named Henry! Henry the Eighth, I am!

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BROTHER
dialogues.text: Second verse, same as the first!

dialogues.speaker: FRAT PLEDGES
dialogues.text: Oh, Henry the Eighth, I am, I am!... The crowd of onlookers cheer as one EXHAUSTED FRAT PLEDGE passes out, hitting his head hard on the pavement.  39. Horrified by the re-play, Tree begins to run blindly! Reaching the end of the quad, Tree bounds down the steps and CRASHES into... Keith.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Morning Tree. Tree backs away from him. Eyes wide with fear.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tree-- She keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree slams the door shut. She starts for the stairs but is forced to grab the rail. She’s having a hard time breathing.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Oh-my-god. You sneaky beeyotch! Tree turns around. Danielle sees tear-streaked cheeks, the wild look in her eyes. DANIELLE (CONT’D) What’s wrong? She can’t answer. Doesn’t know how to explain. Instead, she just runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tree?! She vanishes around the corner. DANIELLE (CONT’D) (baffled) Freakshow. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - MORNING Tree throws herself on her bed and sobs into her pillow. Lori steps out of the bathroom, wet and wrapped in a towel.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: She finally rolls-in.  40. Lori realizes Tree’s upset.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I feel like I’m losing my mind, Lori. I don’t know what’s happening to me. I’m so confused.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Just calm down and start from the beginning. Tree takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Have you ever had deja vu?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Sure. Everybody has.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Well, I’m having it but like...big time. This isn’t going to make any sense but, I’ve already lived through this day. Twice.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Tree--

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I know! It’s not possible but it’s happening! I swear to god!

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Look, Tree, I know this is a hard day with your mom and all.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You made me a cupcake! For my birthday! You’re about to give it to me, right? And later tonight there’s a surprise party!

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Who told you? Was it Becky?  4l.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No! Nobody told me! Don’t you see? I know what’s going to happen before it happens! Tree grabs Lori’s arm, desperate/afraid.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lori, somebody’s going to kill me today. Lori looks at Tree in total shock -- but she suddenly cracks a smile and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Okay. I get it. Who put you up to this? Danielle?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No! This isn’t some stupid joke! I’m being totally serious! It’s already happened! But I don’t know who it is!

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Okay, Tree...you’re starting to freak me out.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: How do you think I feel?!

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Tree, listen to me. Nobody’s trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yes, they are--

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Tree! Look at me! Gripping Tree by the shoulders, Lori looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to take the day off. Skip class. Get some rest. Maybe you can talk to somebody.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Who?  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're CLOSE ON a “FEELINGS CHART” (a poster featuring a series of cartoon faces with categorized moods matching corresponding expressions.) Tree sits rigidly on a floral print sofa, surrounded by other posters encouraging “COMMUNICATION!” and proclaiming “DEPRESSION: IT’S NOT YOUR FAULT”. A light rap on the door precedes the entrance of DR. MARY TURTLEBAUM (late 30’s, wispy, doe-eyed, saccharine). She checks her file before offering her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Hello, Teresa, I’m Mary. Mary sits down across from Tree, pen and pad at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, Teresa...what brings you here today? Tree struggles with how to even broach her crisis. After a few prolonged seconds of false-starts and hand- wringing, she decides just to blurt it out:

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m reliving the same day over and over.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That’s fairly common. Lots of people feel stuck in a rut. The routine of life can often feel--

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No, you don’t get it! I’m literally living the same day over and over! It’s like I can’t get out of it! And somebody keeps killing me!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: He’s wearing one of those school masks! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The other night -- which will actually be tonight --he stabbed me to death near the quad and then last night he chopped my head off with a window! (off Mary’s reaction) It was broken. He smashed it with a hockey stick. (off Mary’s raised eyebrow) Nevermind. Point is, I keep dying and then waking up. I’m scared out of my mind! I don’t want to die again! Mary takes a beat to put this all down in her pad. Tree waits in agony for a response, for some miraculous intervention that’s going to make sense of it all. What she gets is:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (sing-song) Okee-dokey. I’m just going to recap to make sure I’m getting this straight. (reading from her note pad) You wake up today, Tuesday the 18th, and you re-live the same day over and over, and the same exact things happen in a specific, linear order, before a maniac wearing a mask stabs you or chops your head off, and then you wake up and start all over again?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yes! But you make it sound so crazy when you say it like that!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Teresa, first of all, there’s no such thing as “crazy”. There’s a very logical explanation for what’s happening to you.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: There is?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Of course. Stress, fatigue, repressed emotional trauma -- these are all powerful triggers. Now what we can do, together, is figure out which of these factors is playing a role in your...situation. Tree stares at Mary incredulously as Mary begins flipping through her schedule book.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m a little booked tomorrow, but Thursday is wide open.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Lady, have you heard a single word I’ve said?! I can’t come in Thursday! I’1l be dead!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (placating) I’m so sorry, Teresa. You’re absolutely right. What I meant to say was, in two days, which will still be today, you can come in and we can get down to the bottom of this.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Right. Sounds great. I'll just die a couple more times before I come back here to sit on this ugly couch so you can make me feel crazy and then tell me there’s no such thing as crazy even though what’s happening to me is totally- fucking-crazy! Tree jumps up and grabs her bag.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for the help. She storms out and slams the door so hard the “FEELINGS” poster falls off the wall.  45. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - EVENING The dresser slowly lumbers across the floor as Tree pushes it flush against her bedroom door. Along the way, a few items fall off the top -- including Tree’s graduation PHOTO with mom and dad. Tree picks it up, studies the image for a second, tracing her finger over her mother’s smiling face. Suddenly, somebody tries the handle. Tree looks at the door startled. There’s a knock then:

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tree? Why’s the door locked?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m...uh...just need a little privacy.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What time are you going to the party tonight?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I don’t know...later. Tree looks at the clock -- 9:22 Then the digit changes to 9:23 BLACKOUT.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Our tuition dollars at work. The lights turn back on. DANIELLE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Anyhoo...don’t be too late or all the cute Sigma boys will be taken. Tree listens to Danielle’s FOOTSTEPS walking away -- her eyes suddenly filling with purpose...  46. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - LATER Tree has dismantled her Ikea night stand and is nailing the wood panels over the windows. Finished, she gives them a good tug to be sure they’re secure. With the windows sealed-shut and the door locked and securely blocked, she feels “safe”. TV back on, Tree finds the CUPCAKE Lori made for her sitting on her desk. She settles onto her bed and begins peeling the paper off of her treat. About to take a bite, Tree notices the “Road Rules” marathon is still playing. It feels like a bad omen, she opts for a station change. Tree begins searching for the remote but it’s nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Lori...what’d she do with the freagin’ remote? Tree goes to her desk, riffling through loose papers when she comes upon her stack of mail and THE BLACK ENVELOPE. There’s no post mark and the front is blank. Perplexed, Tree opens it... Inside the envelope is one of those 3-D cards featuring a weird little Elf waving a “Happy Birthday” sign attached to a tiny spring. As the sign bounces the Elf GIGGLES through a tiny, hidden voice box. On the blank side of the card, written in black marker, a child-like scrawl reads: “HOPE IT’S YOUR LAST ONE...” Disturbed, Tree slowly lowers the card when -- The TV turns off. Tree looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell? She walks over and turns it back on manually. “Road Rules”. Tree immediately changes the channel.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first station change brings us to the famous opening credits of “The Twilight Zone”.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No shit. She changes the channel again to an unfolding “Breaking Story” on a local news station. A female REPORTER standing outside the entrance to an EMERGENCY ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: --where suspected murderer Joseph Tombs is being treated for a gunshot wound following a deadly shoot-out this morning that left one officer dead. The story CUTS TO a MUG-SHOT of the menacing killer. REPORTER (CONT’D) Tombs had been the subject of a nationwide manhunt-- The TV suddenly TURNS OFF AGAIN... Tree freezes. In the stillness, we HEAR a scraping noise coming from THE CLOSET. At this moment, it dawns on Tree that she never checked the room before she barricaded herself inside. Picking up the HAMMER, Tree advances slowly toward the closet -- the door is slightly ajar. She grips the handle...raises the hammer, ready to strike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. Tree notes a lone wire hanger, gently scraping on the wall.  48. She sighs with relief and closes the door. But as she turns around, Tree’s focus moves to another part of the room... THE BATHROOM. Through the open doorway, she can see the shower -- the opaque curtain is drawn. Did it just move a little? Tree crosses the room.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Tree stops at the shower. As she reaches out for the curtain... The TV turns back on! A loud COMMERCIAL blares, scaring the shit out of us! Spinning around, Tree looks at the TV. Her eyes slowly move to the bed and then the slip cover where the sole of a BLACK BOOT is just sticking out from under the fabric. He's hiding under the bed! Tip-toeing back into the bedroom, Tree gingerly kneels down in front of the bed, keeping her hammer at the ready. Looking over Tree’s shoulder, we SEE the shower curtain is OPEN -- as the masked killer emerges from the bathroom! Tree doesn’t see him creeping toward her, the long blade of his knife at his side... Tree yanks the slip up and finds the boot -- but it’s not attached to anybody. That’s when she HEARS it... BREATHING. Tree slowly turns around... Before she can scream the killer strikes! Tree narrowly dodges the blade as it digs into the mattress! Running for her door, Tree tries to push the dresser out of the way but there isn’t time! The killer is already behind her.  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR Tree screaming in agony as her blood begins to spill-out under the crack of the blocked door...

dialogues.speaker: SLAM CUT
dialogues.text: INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING The tolling bells outside are drowned out by Tree’s hysterical awakening -- THRASHING and SCREAMING so loud that Carter himself screams from the shock!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?! Jumping out of bed too quickly, Tree suddenly doubles- over in pain. Carter rushes to her side.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tree --- She shoves him back. Her cell phone plays “Happy Birthday”. Tree grabs the phone and throws it against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP
dialogues.text: Afraid, Carter jumps back. Tree grabs her head, distraught.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ohmygod..ohmygod...make it stop, please make it stop... Carter tries to approach Tree again.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? Are you sick?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Just get away from me! Pain subsiding, Tree pulls the T-shirt off and starts changing into her clothes. Carter spins around.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don’t know what’s going on but --  50. Carter turns around -- Tree’s already out the door. A second later, the lanky freshman peeks into Carter's room.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN
dialogues.text: Dude...what's up the psycho- hottie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree staggers through the crowded thoroughfare -- her eyes darting left and right. Everyone she passes has an air of menace. Anyone could be her killer. TREE’S POV -- VARIOUS “SUSPECTS” STARING BACK... * A PROFESSOR peering at us over the rim of his coffee cup. * A PAINTER, wearing a bandana over his mouth, looks up from his work to tracks us with his eyes. * A STUDENT VENDOR, working behind an espresso kiosk, stares at us through a glass partition. Becoming winded again, Tree stops in the middle of the walk way. The student protester thrusts the petition at Tree!

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Stop global warming! Tree staggers back. The car alarm goes off. Then the sprinklers. Behind her, the FRAT GUYS are singing...

dialogues.speaker: FRAT PLEDGES
dialogues.text: -- not a Willie or a Sam! I’m the eighth ole’ man named Henry! Henry the Eighth, I am!

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BROTHER
dialogues.text: Second verse, same as the first!  51. Tree begins to turn in a circle, the world spinning around her in a kaleidoscopic nightmare! The protester, the car alarm and the frat guy’s voices grow louder and louder! Students begin to stop and stare at Tree, who is caught in the middle like a trapped animal. The world begins to whirl faster and faster... The voices become louder and louder... Until everything builds to a deafening crescendo! And Tree collapses onto the pavement. INT. TREE’S HOSPITAL ROOM - AFTERNOON Tree is arguing with DR. ELLIOT WINTER (50’s, kind face). Arms folded, pouting like an indignant little girl, Tree doesn’t want to be here.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: It’s just a concussion right? That’s not a big deal. Why can’t I go?

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: Where’s your father? We’ve been trying to contact him but we must have an old number on file.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What do you need him for?

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: We need your full medical history. Our system’s down from the rolling black-outs and we can’t retrieve any records. Specifically, we're trying to find out how many times you've been hospitalized.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: Excuse me?  52.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’ve never been hospitalized before. A grave expression falls over the doctor’s face.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Dr. Winter opens a file and puts up a series of X-RAYS on the LIGHT BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: We just got these back from the lab. You see here -- He runs his finger over a CHEST X-RAY.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are your lungs. There’s some scar tissue here. At first we thought it was a sign of pneumothorax. (off Tree’s blank stare) A collapsed lung. But then we saw these... He points to light-colored lines crisscrossing through her NECK and LOWER ABDOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are signs of major trauma, Teresa. Given the severity of the scar tissue and the size of the lesions... He shakes his head, unable to finish his sentence.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What?! Slowly, Dr. Winter turns his baffled gaze on Tree.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: You should be dead. The words sink in slowly.  53.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're going to keep you here for observation. Your heart rate’s a little low and we need--

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I have to go. Tree starts to get out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: Whoa. Hold, on. You’re not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I have to go! He’s going to kill me again! Dr. Winter forces Tree back into her bed.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: Teresa, I need you to calm down...

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: (calling out) I need a little help in here! Two NURSE’S rush into the room.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get me three cc’s of pentobarbital right away. Tree grabs Dr. Winter’s arms, pleading desperately:

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Please...I don’t want to die again...

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: Nobody’s going to hurt you Teresa. We just want to help. The nurse returns with the shot. Tree takes one look at the needle and starts freaking out.  54.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouting at the nurses) Hold her down, damn it! Arms pinned, Tree is helpless as the needle sinks into her skin. She begins to slow down, losing her motor skills. In a matter of seconds, she’s out again. INT. TREE’S HOSPITAL ROOM - EVENING A thick silence fills the air as Tree slowly begins to emerge from the fog of her sedation. From her blurry POV we’re looking at the door. It slowly begins to OPEN. A MAN enters... As he draws closer, we SEE he’s wearing THE MASK. Tree opens her mouth to scream, but no sound comes out! He reaches out to grab her! Tree recoils! But Tree’s vision pulls into focus and she realizes it’s just Gregory and he’s not wearing a mask. He sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Hey...Tree it’s me. It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What are you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Just checking on you. I heard they had to sedate you. The drugs take a little while to wear off.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What day is it?

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Tuesday, the 18th. Why? Tree closes her eyes. It wasn't a bad dream. Her eyes fill with tears.  55.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Nobody...believes me.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Believes what?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: That I’m dying...every day. Must be the drugs. Gregory brushes her hair out of her face.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: I can’t stay long. Stephanie’s gotten us into some god-awful charity thing tonight. But I‘1l come check on you first thing in the morning. Tree licks her dry-lips.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m really thirsty. Gregory starts to pour her some water.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No water. Can you get me a Coke?

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Sure. Be right back. He kisses her forehead and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory fights with the machine as it won’t take his dollar. It finally sucks it in. He punches the button as the soda can dumps into the tray. We TRACK Gregory back to Tree’s room.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: (announcing as he enters) Special delivery... INT. TREE’S HOSPITAL ROOM - CONTINUOUS Entering the room, Gregory comes to an abrupt halt...  56. ANGLE ON -- TREE’S EMPTY BED She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree quietly exits the elevator -- there’s only one NURSE at the station but she’s too busy reading a cheesy harlequin novel to notice Tree as she tip-toes right past her. Reaching the door to Gregory’s office, Tree glances to her right and notices the POLICE OFFICER isn’t stationed at the end of the hall. But his chair is still there beside a fresh, steaming cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerly closing the door behind her, Tree goes straight to Gregory’s desk and opens the top drawer. She grabs what she came for... HIS CAR KEYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peering into the hallway, Tree makes sure the coast is clear. But as she reaches the elevator, the doors automatically open. Tree freezes... Gregory steps out.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Tree? What are you doing? Tree bolts! GREGORY (CONT’D) Tree! Running down the hall, Tree makes a desperate dash for the emergency exit. She’s still weak so it’s easy for Gregory to gain ground. Passing a GURNEY, Tree stops to push it in Gregory’s direction. It slows him down a little but not enough. Tree collides with the FIRE EXIT DOOR but it doesn’t budge.  57. Gregory stops a few feet away from Tree. GREGORY (CONT’D) Tree, listen to me --

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Tree, you’re delirious. Let me help you. Tree turns back to the fire door and begins banging on the handle.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Somebody help me!!! She feels something WET hit her hospital gown. Tree spins around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes wide, blood running out of the corner of his mouth. He collapses to the floor revealing THE KILLER STANDING

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No... The killer rips the knife from Gregory's back! Tree kicks the handle this time. The door SWINGS OPEN just as the killer steps over Gregory’s body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hobbling down the stairs, Tree looks up as the killer pursues! Using everything she’s got, Tree runs down four more floors until she reaches the FIRST PARKING LEVEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bursting out the door, Tree screams for help but there’s no one around. Behind her, the killer continues his relentless chase.  58. Tree scans the area, desperately searching for Gregory’s car. There’s too many! It could be anywhere! She starts pressing the ALARM button on his key-chain. The killer is getting closer! Frantically pressing the button, an alarm finally goes off two rows over. Tree and the killer are about equidistant to the flashing lights and honking horn of Gregory’s car. They both pause for a split-second. Waiting to see who makes the first move... Sucking in a deep breath, Tree goes for it! Running harder than she’s ever run before in her life! The killer keeps pace. It looks like they’re going to make it to Gregory’s car at the same time but Tree gets there first. INT. GREGORY’S CAR - CONTINUOUS Lunging into the car, Tree slams the door shut and hits the LOCK BUTTON just as the killer SLAMS against the driver’s side window! Tree SCREAMS! The killer immediately begins pounding the glass with the butt of his knife. Tree tries to start the car but her hands are trembling too much.

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: The glass begins to crack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it slips into the ignition. Tree starts the engine and throws it in REVERSE! Peeling rubber, Gregory’s car flies back and smashes into a parked car. Looking ahead, Tree sees the killer standing a few feet ahead. Slamming the gear into DRIVE she stomps on the pedal -- the car lunges forward. The killer narrowly dives out of the way!  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer slowly rises to his feet as Tree speeds off in Gregory’s car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing off the campus grounds, Gregory’s car fish-tails onto the main road. INT. GREGORY’S CAR - NIGHT The lights of the isolated campus fade from view as Tree pushes the speedometer past 80. Realizing she’s escaped, Tree is overcome by a wild euphoria. She begins pounding the steering wheel, laughing through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I did it!!! Her celebration is cut short by the sound of SIRENS. Tree glances into the rear-view window as a POLICE CAR closes- in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. Tree slows down and pulls onto the shoulder. OFFICER BILL SANTORA (40’s, seen too many Clint Eastwood movies) saunters up to the driver’s side and raps his knuckles on the glass. Tree rolls the window down, trying to stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know. I was speeding.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SANTORA
dialogues.text: Turn the engine off.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Sorry, officer. She kills the engine.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SANTORA
dialogues.text: License and registration.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Um...I don’t have them.  60.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SANTORA
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (blurting out) Someone’s trying to kill me again!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SANTORA
dialogues.text: Again?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yes! (realizing how that sounds ) I mean no! I mean...he’s tried before but this time I got away but I didn’t have time to get my clothes and my driver’s license was in my pocket. Santora grabs his FLASHLIGHT and shines it in Tree's face. She squints back.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SANTORA
dialogues.text: Ma’am, are you under the influence of alcohol or any other controlled substance?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No! I’m not-- (pause/epiphany) Wait. If I am, does that mean you'll arrest me and put me ina jail cell?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SANTORA
dialogues.text: That’s usually how it works. Realizing she couldn’t be in a safer place:

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m drunk!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SANTORA
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Wasted! And I’m high. Pills, weed, you name it man! I’m on it! Santora couldn’t be more confused.  61.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SANTORA
dialogues.text: Well...then I’m placing you under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Good idea. She gets out of the car. Santora cuffs Tree’s hands behind her back and leads her to his cruiser. As he opens the back door, Tree looks at him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Officer Santora: Weirdo. He pushes Tree into the backseat. The POLICE RADIO suddenly CRACKLES.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: All units, we've got a 187 at the university hospital. Santora pauses, listening to the homicide report. DISPATCHER (CONT’D) Suspect is believed to be an escaped patient. Be advised-- As Santora looks at Tree’s hospital gown he’s suddenly flooded by a BRIGHT LIGHT! We HEAR an engine roar! Before he can even turn, Santora is struck by a speeding car! The impact SHEERS the back door right off as Tree SCREAMS in terror! The UNKNOWN VEHICLE makes a hard 180 and stops. Hands cuffed tightly behind her back, Tree struggles to get out of the cruiser. Feet crunching over broken glass, she finally manages to shimmy out. The other car idles...Tree can’t see the DRIVER beyond the blinding HIGH-BEAMS. Then she hears it: a door squeaking open. Footsteps begin to draw closer. Tree looks around, there’s nowhere to hide. Just miles of woods... The driver, steps in front of one of the headlights -- backlit, we SEE it’s the masked killer.  62.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (screaming) Why are you doing this to me?! Unsheathing his hunting knife, the killer begins to advance. Tree runs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting for balance, Tree makes a futile attempt to flee as her killer, with a clear advantage, takes his time. Toying with her. Tree screams for help but there’s nothing but miles of forest. Branches whip Tree in the face as her bare feet crunch over twigs and, tiny jagged rocks. With only a two-second lead, Tree runs as fast as she can. Looking over her shoulder, the killer is gaining ground! Ahead, Tree sees some LIGHTS through the trees up ahead!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: HELP
dialogues.text: She looks back over her shoulder again -- she’s suddenly confused. He's not behind her anymore... Breaking out of the forest, Tree reaches a short clearing -- she can see the lights of a FARM come into view. Then she DROPS OUT of frame! She just ran off a cliff. We HEAR Tree cry out as she plummets over two hundred feet! As she’s about to make impact with the jagged ROCKS below we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree has just been placed into the backseat by Officer Santora. A split-second after he closes the car door...

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: Santora is struck by a speeding car as it broad-sides the police car in a flash of scraping metal and flying sparks! Tree screams! Looking though the plexi-glass partition, she can see Santora’s crumpled body, mercilessly displayed in the police car's headlights. Tree looks for the other car but it’s nowhere to be seen... Suddenly, a pair of HIGH-BEAMS appear -- blinding Tree as the car roars toward her at full throttle! Tree goes for the door handle! But there is none!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blazing a head-on collision course! Tree braces for impact but the other car SLAMS on its brakes at the last second! Tires SCREECH! Then...silence. The cop car is completely flooded with light now. Tree shields her eyes as we HEAR a door open and close outside followed by slow, encroaching FOOTSTEPS. Suddenly a HAND slaps against Tree’s window! Tree yelps as the MASKED KILLER comes into view, peering at Tree like a bug in a jar.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What do you want?! He presents something to her...A BIRTHDAY CANDLE? The killer lights it. What he does next is even more baffling to Tree. He simply turns around and goes back to his car.  64. The killer's car starts to back away...headlights fading until they’re the size of distant FLASHLIGHT BEAMS...

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded) Where’s he going?... And then his lights just GO OUT. Beat...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE KILLER'S CAR
dialogues.text: The black-gloved hand emerges from the open driver’s-side window holding the birthday candle. He drops it...

dialogues.speaker: A FLAME IGNITES
dialogues.text: The fire starts at the killer’s car (driver’s side) quickly running toward the police car!

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Tree beats on the glass but, it too, is bullet-proof. Looking toward the rear of the police car, Tree can see the damaged gas tank -- hemorrhaging GASOLINE from the previous collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running faster and faster in Tree’s direction!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face framed in the window as the glass suddenly reflects an ORANGE/RED glow...

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh Fu--

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The car explodes into a massive ball of fire! INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING The tower bell rings one last time as Tree’s eyes SNAP OPEN...  65.
