ECU -- we SEE the FIRE BALL flare and then vanish in the reflection of Tree’s eyes. She sits up and wipes the sweat from her brow. A brief glance around the room reminds her she’s still trapped in the same day.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (sighing) Here we go again... The opening bass-line of a White-Stripes-ish song starts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two KAPPA GIRLS (who were X-ing in the bathroom at Tree’s B-Day party) stare up at the second floor as BOOKS, PAPERS, even a LAPTOP fly out of Tree’s bedroom window. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - MORNING Desk cleared of debris, Tree sits down and begins to jot- down a list of NAMES in a small note-pad. The “suspects” include KEITH, STEPHANIE, DANIELLE, and GREGORY... (But she immediately goes back and crosses off Gregory since he already died in front of her.) EXT. KEITH’S DORM ROOM - NIGHT On her tippy-toes, Tree peers through a first-floor window. From her POV we can SEE Keith, already fast- asleep in his over-sized Sponge-Bob pajamas. Tree looks disappointed as she crosses his name of the top of the list. She turns around and--

dialogues.speaker: --WHAM
dialogues.text: She collides with the masked killer. Looking down, Tree finds the handle of a knife protruding from her stomach. PRELAP: “Happy Birthday” plays on Tree’s cell phone.  66. INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING Already, sitting up in Carter’s bed, Tree grabs her ringing cell phone and makes a perfect basket-toss into Carter’s trash can. Carter looks at her: crazy bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree cuts huge chunks of her hair off (which has already been died a hot shade of bright-pink).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danielle and the other Kappa girls stare in horror/disgust as Tree (sporting her new-do) sprays a bottle of Cheeze-Wiz into her open mouth. EXT. GREGORY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Gregory escorts Stephanie (he’s in a tux, she’s ina gown) out of their up-scale house. CLOSE ON -- THE PAD as Stephanie’s name is crossed out. Gregory's sedan pulls out of the circular driveway -- Tree is suddenly tackled by her killer! Tree falls backward into a KOI POND. She manages to knock the mask off, but the killer shoves her head UNDERWATER... Tree’s POV -- through the rippling water, she can’t make out the identity of her attacker. INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING Tree wakes up and instantly leans over Carter’s bedside to puke a stream of pond-water. On Carter: gross!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot tastefully, Tree strolls down the thoroughfare COMPLETELY NAKED... ANGLE ON -- THE STUDYING PAIR as they look up and see Tree. The sprinklers go off but they don’t even react because they’re too stunned.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Stop global war-- She sees Tree and pulls her clipboard back. ANGLE ON -- THE FRAT PLEDGES who follow Tree’s naked body with shocked grins. So distracted are they, nobody notices when the exhausted brother passes-out. ANGLE ON -- THE STAIRS where Tree crosses paths with Keith. His eyes look like they’re going to shoot out of his head. As Tree streaks by, she winks at him. Keith turns too quickly to follow Tree and loses his footing. He eats shit down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree is walking with Danielle when a student bumps Danielle. A BLACK CARD falls out of her bag. Tree grabs it...it’s just like the one she found in her room earlier. Danielle looks guilty. Tree attacks her and a cat-fight ensues right there on the street. A few BYSTANDERS try to stop them. Danielle and Tree fall off the sidewalk and onto the street. We HEAR a HORN blare one long note... Tree and Danielle both turn as an on-coming BUS speeds toward them. They both scream in unison then -- SPLAT! INSERT: Tree’s “suspect list” as Tree crosses off Danielle’s name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree, donning army fatigues and camo face paint, makes herself small behind a Tree. She waits, clutching a baseball bat, as we HEAR approaching footsteps... Just as the killer enters her periphery, Tree jumps out and SWINGS!

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: He goes down. But Tree’s face falls when she realizes it wasn’t the killer. It was just BECKY (her chubby Kappa sister), sneaking onto campus with a box of doughnuts, which are now splayed around her unconscious body.  68. Tree drops the bat and rushes to Becky’s aid. Suddenly, there’s a SNAPPING SOUND behind Tree. She looks over her shoulder and finds the killer hovering over her -- armed with Tree’s own bat! But instead of screaming, Tree just sighs... SLOW MOTION: the bat swings in CLOSE-UP and connects with the side of Tree’s SKULL! Continuing with the motion, Tree’s head slowly tilts out of frame and lands on-- --A PILLOW as we END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: MATCH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING Tree’s HEAD lies on the pillow in the same position. She opens her right-eye, squinting... Outside, the bell tolls -- wincing in pain, Tree gradually pushes herself up:

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: This-is-getting-really-friggin'- old... Looking to her right, she sees Carter staring at her. “Happy Birthday” plays on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m fine. Really. Tree stands. She grabs her phone and dismisses the call from her father.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you-- She holds her hand up.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Carter...sshh. A moment. Carter nods as Tree shuffles over to his desk and unearths the toiletry bag. She helps herself to his aspirin.  69.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How did you... He watches Tree pour 2...3...6 pills into the palm of her hand. CARTER (CONT’D) I don’t think you’re supposed to take that many. You could die.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: If only it were that easy. (snapping her fingers) Water, por-favor. As Carter retrieves a bottle from his bedside, Tree is already at his door. She pulls it open -- the lanky Freshman is already there but before he can say it...

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi. I’m the so-called “fine- vagine. Freshman to Tree -- How the hell did she know he was going to say that?

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if that’s the way you refer to girls, then you and your hand are going to have a very lasting relationship. Tree pushes him back gently.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for stopping by. And she closes the door in the freshman’s stunned face. Turning around, Carter is still wearing the same confused look on his face. Tree takes the bottle of water from him and knocks back the pills before chugging down what’s left of the water. She tosses the empty bottle on the floor and finally acknowledges Carter’s dumbfounded stare.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?  70.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Are you always this charming in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (shit-eating grin) Just this one. Tree pulls her T-shirt off. Carter spins around as she starts getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So...bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You were screaming before you fell out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Oh. I was dying. Again. Dressed, she turns around.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a long story.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’ve got nothing to do.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Trust me. You’1l think I’m bonkers. Tree bends down to grab her shoes and starts to leave. But the same damn sticker gives her pause. “TODAY IS THE FIRST DAY OF THE REST OF YOUR LIFE” Tree turns around...

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seriously, I hate this sticker. INT. HALLWAY -- CARTER’S DORM - CONTINUOUS Carter catches up with Tree at the stairs.  71.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Why are you following me?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I hate when people start something and they don’t finish.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Look, no offense, but there’s really no point in explaining any of it to you. Every time I try, I end up sounding crazy which, at this point, I must be. She reaches the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree puts her shoes on just outside the dorm. Carter is still tailing her.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So you’re having bad dreams. I took an elective course on neurocognition and dream content.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Hooray for you.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Maybe I can help?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Can you stop me from re-living the same day, everyday, only to be murdered by someone I may or may not know? Carter stops. Huh?

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thought so. Tree keeps going. Carter catches up again.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You literally think you’re re- living the same day?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yup.  72.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And somebody kills you?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yup again. They pass the student protestor.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Stop global warming! She thrusts the clipboard at Tree, who takes it and hands it off to Carter. It stalls him, leaving Carter in Tree's wake. He has to run and catch up yet again!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Come on. You’re just messing with me, right? You don’t seriously think you’re re-living the same day? Annoyed, Tree stops.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Car alarm...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What? Just then, the CAR ALARM goes off. Tree turns, facing the pair studying on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Sprinklers... She snaps her fingers and the sprinklers go off. Tree grabs Carter by his shoulders and turns him to face the FRAT PLEDGES.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See that pledge over there? The one with the baseball cap? She points to the exhausted FRAT PLEDGE.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah?  73.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: He’s going to pass out right now. Thump. He goes down on cue. Shocked, Carter slowly turns and looks at Tree.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any further questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muzak plays softly in the background as Tree noisily sucks down the last drops of her Oreo Blizzard through a straw. Carter is staring at her, mouth agape.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Please stop looking at me like I have a dildo stuck to my forehead.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sorry. I’m just trying to work this whole thing out.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: And how’s that going for you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I guess it’s kinda like that movie “Groundhog’s Day”, only you're not Bill Murray and instead of zany- fun you're being violently butchered.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Well, you’re a nerd. Don’t you have some scientific theory about it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: First of all, I wouldn’t classify myself as a nerd.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Carter, you have a poster of Boba Fett in your dorm room. You’re a nerd.  74.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Whatever. Just because I like science fiction doesn’t make me an expert on crazy chicks trapped in the same day. Tree looks down, a little hurt. Carter feels bad. CARTER (CONT’D) Look, if I were you I would stop trying to figure out how it was happening and start figuring out why.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: There has to be a reason you’re stuck in this day. Out of all the days of your life, this day must have some kind of meaning.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: But it’s like any other day. Except the dying part. Suddenly, Tree’s phone rings -- she looks at her CALLER ID. It’s DAD again. Tree thinks of answering it...but balks. Tree nods.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (off the ring-tone) It’s your birthday? CARTER (CONT’D) Hello?!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: So what? Birthdays are just excuses people make to eat cake and get presents and shit. There's no real meaning to a birthday.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It’s symbolic! Whoever is killing you knows it’s your birthday!  75.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here -— Carter unfolds a napkin and removes a PEN from his shirt pocket. Tree stares at the pen. CARTER (CONT’D) Okay. That's nerdy. Let’s move on. Who knows it’s your birthday today and who would want to kill you?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Well, thanks to my sorority sisters, the whole school knows it’s my birthday. They’re going to throw me this stupid surprise party tonight. It could be anyone. At first I thought it was Gregory, but he got killed last night.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Who's Gregory?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: One of my professors. We’ve been having an affair.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Hey, mister “I brought a drunk girl home and took advantage of her". Don’t judge.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: For the record, I didn’t take advantage of you. I slept on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (shocked) We didn’t --

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No. You were wasted and I was worried you’d fall or choke on your own vomit like Janis Joplin.  76. Sitting across from her in the booth, Tree discovers two things about Carter: he’s probably the sweetest guy in the whole world and he’s actually kinda cute. But she’s not letting her guard down.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Well...thanks but I would have been fine.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can see that. Tree manages a laugh. It’s the first time we’ve seen her smile like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is walking Tree back to her house. The sun is out, the flowers are in bloom, and if they weren’t talking about Tree dying violently every day, the moment would almost seem romantic.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: There has to be somebody you didn’t think of.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: That’s it. Everyone who'd want to kill me had a solid alibi.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: But it could be somebody who knows you but you don’t necessarily know them.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Carter, that’s just dumb. Do you know how many dozens of people that could be. I'd spend the rest of my life dying trying to figure that out. Carter snickers.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You just said you’d have to spend the rest of your life dying. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was ironic. (off Tree’s blank expression) Get it...”rest of your life dying”... (she’s still not laughing) Sorry. I'll shut up now. They reach Tree’s house. She plops-down on the short wall and releases an exasperated sigh of defeat. CARTER (CONT’D) Can I ask you a dumb question?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just leave the country?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean like on my private jet? I don’t even have a passport.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Look, my parents gave me a credit card for emergencies. You have a driver’s license, right? Tree nods. CARTER (CONT’D) That’s it, then. We’ll put you on a plane. Europe. Mexico. Whatever. By the time you get there it’1ll be tomorrow. Even if they send you back cause you don’t have a passport it’1ll still be the next day. You’ll be home free!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (genuinely touched) You’d...do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: My parents will freak when they get the bill but if it means keeping you alive...yeah. Of course.  78. PRELAP: A HORN beeping... INT. CARTER’S VW JETTA - DUSK Carter and Tree are stuck in a long line of cars trailing back from the interstate on-ramp.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. There aren't even enough people in this stupid town to make a traffic jam. (punching the dash) God, I hate this day! Carter clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So, apart from the obvious reasons, why are you so down on your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I just think it’s dumb. He looks at her. He's not buying that answer.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My mom and I were born on the same day.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And you've had to share it all your life and it pisses you off?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No. The opposite. It was always the best day of the year. I’d get to skip school, we’d go to the beach. My dad would get mom and I this big cake. There was always just one candle on it. Dad said it was cause on this one day the greatest people he knew were born. (she laughs) Mom said it was cause the cake would look like a bonfire if both our ages were on it. Her smile fades. Carter sees the sadness in Tree’s eyes.  79.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: She died, huh? Tree nods as she shoves her hurt back down.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Three years ago. Cancer.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sorry. That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...that’s life right? Everybody dies. Some more than others. Inching closer to the on-ramp, Tree suddenly sits up in her seat -- her gaze fixed ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directing the traffic around a small fender-bender, we immediately recognize him as the SAME COP that pulled Tree over before.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He died...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: It was my fault. I made it happen. Tree looks stricken with guilt as she watches the cop, dutifully waving the cars toward the on-ramp -- completely unaware that three cars away, a young girl he’s never even met has seen him die violently.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Take me back!  80.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Tree, I’m getting you out of here! Reaching over, Tree grabs the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car behind Carter SLAMS on its breaks as Carter’s car flips a bitch, swerving into oncoming traffic! Narrowly escaping a major accident, Carter slips into the flow of traffic heading BACK TOWARDS campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking his head disapprovingly as he continues to direct cars. INT. CARTER’S CAR - CONTINUOUS Checking his rear-view mirror, Carter sighs with a mix of relief and frustration.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Every time I try to run, somebody dies! Nick, Gregory, that cop! If I leave who knows how many more people will die?!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So then what?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, okay?! I just...I don’t know. Carter turns to look at her. His face is so sympathetic it clams Tree’s frayed nerves like a salve. Looking ahead, the horizon is ablaze with a crimson glow as the school’s BELL TOWER rises above the woods. Ominous. Foretelling.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) I know one thing...no more running.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vexed Danielle bumps into Tree as she exits Tree's room, holding Tree’s blouse.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Where were you? (off Tree’s blank stare) You ditched our house meeting.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Danielle, I’m sorry. I'm just...going through a lot right now.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: It’s mandatory, Tree. I just finished telling your roommate the same thing. If you guys want to be Kappa sisters you have to stick to the schedule or else you're out.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Then I’m out. Tree yanks her top out of Danielle’s hands and walks off. Danielle is floored.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Have fun back in the dorms! INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - EVENING Lori is zipping-up a small bag when Tree enters the room. As she flops down on the bed, Tree notices the cupcake sitting on the night stand.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: She just bitch you out too?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I so could care less.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You two fighting?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Danielle and I?  82.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: No, you and Gregory. He asked where you were. Said you didn’t show up to his class.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I can’t even think about that right now.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I'm off. I have--

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: --a double shift. I know.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: (weird) Right. Lori starts out the door but stops. Something is on the tip of her tongue...but she chickens-out.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See ya later.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Bye. Lori leaves. Tree lays back down on her bed. Exhaustion and pain have taken their toll as she easily dozes off. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - LATER Tree wakes up. Looks at the clock...9:19 Danielle bangs on the door before entering in a huff. She’s all dolled-up sans Tree’s totally cute top.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Well, it was supposed to be a surprise but since you’re being a total bitch I’ve decided to spoil it. The party at the Sigma house tonight is a surprise birthday party for your ungrateful-ass so I suggest you suck it up and go. Just don’t even try talking to me when you’re there. Got it?  83. Danielle storms out, slamming the door behind her. Instead of getting upset, Tree grabs the cupcake Lori made her and peels-off the paper shell. She’s about to take a bite when... BLACKOUT.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (in the dark) Damn it! The lights come back on and Tree finds the cupcake resting upside-down on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So much for that. Tree picks it up and dumps it in the trash. She turns the TV on. The “Road Rules Marathon” is still playing.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh for god’s sake, enough already! She changes the channel. The same LOCAL NEWS REPORT is on. But this time, she’s catching the beginning of the story. Tree instantly recognizes the HOSPITAL in a WIDESHOT -- it’s the one on campus.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: I'm standing outside Potsdam University Hospital where suspected murderer Joseph Tombs is being treated for a gunshot wound following a deadly shoot-out this morning that left one officer dead. Tree slowly rises from her bed as they CUT TO Tombs’ mug- shot. REPORTER (CONT’D) Tombs was the subject of a nationwide manhunt that ended after a five month pursuit, across four state lines that left six known female victims. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER (CONT’D) Authorities are still not sure if Tombs is responsible for the murders of more than a dozen other victims he claims to have buried across the vast deserts of Arizona and New Mexico. CLOSE ON -- TREE’S STUNNED FACE

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: He’s been here this whole time? FLASHBACK IN TREE’S MIND: Tree is running from Gregory in the hospital. As she passes the room where the OFFICER’S empty chair sat, she catches a split-second glance at the closed door -- in the tiny, glass window we SEE specks of BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god. He’s going to escape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same NURSE is reading her harlequin novel when Tree runs up to her station, startling her.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: He’s going to escape! Call the police!

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Who?!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Joseph Tombs! Just call the cops! Tree runs down the hall -- she catches a GLIMPSE of the guarding OFFICER as he enters the room!

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! Don’t go in there! He didn’t hear her. Tree spots a FIRE AXE mounted on the wall. She retrieves it and approaches Tombs’ room. Behind her the nurse calls after Tree:

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Excuse me! What are you doing?  85. Tree ignores her and enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing Tree sees is the empty hospital bed with a pair of ARM RESTRAINTS dangling from the guard rails. Moving deeper into the room, Tree discovers the OFFICER'S BODY lying on the other side of the bed. His throat has been slit, his GUN is missing from its holster.

dialogues.speaker: TOMBS, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (Southern drawl) Hey... Tree turns around and finds her killer standing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: TOMBS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's a pretty big axe you got there, little girl. Tombs raises the officer’s stolen handgun. Tree starts to swing the axe -- Tombs fires twice! Both bullets ricochet off the blade, knocking the axe out of Tree’s grip. Tree: Oh shit. Tree bolts for the door! Tombs goes after her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running out the door, Tree slams into the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: What are you--

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Run! Tree tries to grab her but the nurse pauses to peer into the room.

dialogues.speaker: BAM-BAM-BAM
dialogues.text: Three rapid-fire shots take the nurse down. Tree screams and runs for the elevators. She sees another NURSE in the hall -- she bolts for the elevator. By the time Tree reaches her, the elevator doors are already closing!  86.

dialogues.speaker: WAIT
dialogues.text: Too late! The doors close on Tree. Tombs rounds the corner. Tree is trapped in the small reception area. He laughs -- cold-blooded and mocking. Backed against the elevator doors, Tree watches helplessly as Tombs advances, gun raised and ready to fire! Suddenly, Carter appears BEHIND Tombs. He tackles Tombs - the gun goes off twice before falling from his grip! Tree is quick to grab the gun. She aims at Tombs and fires! CLICK... Tree’s eyes widen in horror. It’s empty. Without missing a beat, Tombs pulls a hunting knife tucked away and drives the blade into Carter!

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Carter!!! He’s dead. Tree backpedals away from the elevator as Tombs rises to his feet. Tree turns and runs down another CORRIDOR. It dead-ends at a door marked “STAIRS”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assuming it was another fire-exit, Tree discovers the stairs only go up... ...toward the BELL TOWER. Tombs bursts through the door! Tree races up the wooden steps of this small, cramped stairwell (metal candle holders line the wall) -- Tombs is close behind! He lunges -- -- when Tree reaches back and KICKS him hard in the gut! He slips back a few steps! She kicks him again -- square in the face, shattering part of the mask -- exposing half of Tombs demented grin.  87. Catching her ankle, he yanks her hard and she nearly tumbles atop him! Tree’s kicking at him, but his grip is iron clad. Tombs snaps a metal candle stick from the wall -- prepared to stab her with the jagged metal edge! He brings it down hard, Tree dodges the blow as the pointed edge jams into the soft wood of the stair! Tree seizes the moment and CLAWS his face as hard she can. Tombs screams in agony! Wriggling out from under him, Tree clamors for the entrance to the bell tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later, Tombs steps into the loft. He looks, where could she have gone? There’s no way out. Tree is standing on the railing. He’s confused. She’s three flights up. He notices the rope leading from the bell tower... -..is tied around her neck. She turns, glares him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow, asshole. She leaps! In mid-air, the rope pulls taught! The bell rings out as we...

dialogues.speaker: SLAM CUT
dialogues.text: INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING Outside, the bell is still tolling as Tree’s eyes snap open. She sucks in a breath of air and exhales with a wheeze. Tree looks pale -- we don’t know how many more “lives” she’s got left. But her eyes are filled with purpose. She knows who her killer is and she’s not afraid anymore. Tree sits up and sees Carter staring at her.  88.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You’re up. I wasn’t -- Weak but elated to see him alive, Tree jumps out of bed and throws her arms around Carter.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Thank you! I can’t believe you tried to save me! Carter’s body is rigid in Tree’s awkward embrace. He finally pats her back cordially.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No biggie. She pulls away as her cell phone plays “Happy Birthday”. By the time she retrieves it, she’s missed her dad’s call.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Damn it. Tree pulls her T-shirt off. Carter spins around.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you remember my name --

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Carter. He looks surprised. Tree grabs a pillow from his bed.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I borrow this?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh...sure. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Thanks. She pecks him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See you at lunch. Now he’s really confused but before he can even ask she’s already starting out the door. The freshman is just arriving. As she passes him, Tree SLAPS his ass.  89. The freshman looks at Carter -- WIF? Cue a hot song with a nice beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A walk of shame no more, Tree ditches her heels and chucks them in the bushes before strutting down the main thoroughfare. Sun in her eyes, Tree casually snatches a pair of SUNGLASSES off a passerby and puts them on. He spins around and watches Tree keep going, too shocked to protest. She comes across the PROTESTER...

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Stop global-- Tree grabs the clipboard out of her hand and signs the petition. She shoves it back into the protester’s hands, adding:

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I love Al Gore. Next stop, the frat pledges...

dialogues.speaker: FRAT PLEDGES
dialogues.text: -- not a Willie or a Sam! I’m the eighth ole’ man named Henry! Henry the Eighth, I am!

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BROTHER
dialogues.text: Second verse, same as the first!

dialogues.speaker: FRAT PLEDGES
dialogues.text: Oh, Henry the Eighth, I am, I am!... The EXHAUSTED FRAT PLEDGE starts to go down, but his fall is broken by Tree. She gently lays him down and sticks the pillow under his head. He’s already out like a light as Tree plants a kiss on his forehead. A hush has fallen over the cheering crowd of onlookers. Tree doesn’t pay any attention to them as she keeps going.  90. Reaching the end of the quad, Tree starts down the steps. She sees Keith up ahead and waves to him.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Morning Keith! He almost has a heart attack as she gives him a bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have a great day.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Thanks? As he watches Tree go, his confused expression yields to a smitten grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting up the stairs, Tree is accosted by Danielle.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Oh-my-god. You sneaky beeyotch! Tree turns around.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (rapid-fire) His name’s Carter. We didn’t have sex. But I think if I get through this, I might have his children. Lots to do. Gotta go. Tree’s really racking-up the baffled expressions today. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - MORNING Dressed and ready for the biggest day of her life, Tree smiles as Lori exits the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: She finally rolls-in.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Lori, I’m late for class but I wanted to say that I’m sorry for being such a shitty roommate. I know you’ve been seeing somebody and you couldn’t even talk about it with me and that’s wrong. I should have been there for you. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I want to change that. Starting today.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Tree smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Never better. INT. DR. BUTLER’S SCIENCE CLASS - MORNING Late for class, Tree enters the lecture hall. The door squeaks open, drawing everyone’s attention -- including Gregory's as he turns from the chalkboard. Only Tree doesn’t sit down.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Dr. Butler...a word please? INT. HALLWAY -- OUTSIDE GREGORY’S CLASS - MOMENTS LATER Tree is already waiting outside as Gregory practically explodes out of the lecture hall.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Ending this.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: Wait. What?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I wish I’d never started seeing you. It was wrong. Anyway, I can’t change that. But I can start doing the right thing today. Gregory laughs -- it’s smug and condescending.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: What lame self-help book did that come from?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You know something, you have a wife who really loves you. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you can’t be committed to her then have the balls to leave her. That shut him up. Tree starts off.

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY
dialogues.text: (shouting after her) Don’t expect me to let you coast- by in my class now!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (laughing) I already dropped it! She flips him the bird before disappearing out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kappa lunch meeting is in full swing. Danielle is holding court when she sees Tree approach the table with a tray FULL of junk food. She sets it down and instantly dives-into a wedge of cheesecake. Everyone is staring at her like she’s a leper.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (mouth-full) This is totally amazing. Becky arrives with her tray -- including a sandwich, pasta salad, and the notorious glass of chocolate milk. As she sits down...

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Did I miss the memo?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: What’s up with the fat-fest? We’re Kappa’s. Tree shoves her plate of cheesecake toward Danielle.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Live a little, hon. A few calories won’t kill you.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: No, they’1l just turn me into a chunker like Becky here.  93. Becky looks like she’s going to die. She starts to get up with her tray of food. She doesn’t see Carter coming.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: They collide. Only this time, Tree’s ready as she nimbly ducks out of the way. Becky’s chocolate milk flies off the tray and splashes all over Danielle! Tree cracks up!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh my god! I’m so sorry!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Don’t be. That was perfect. Becky starts laughing with Tree. Danielle gets up. As more people see her dripping wet they start laughing too.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogues.text: Shut up! Her tantrum only makes them laugh harder. Bursting into tears, Danielle runs off with some of her Kappa cronies chasing after her.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean to-- Tree grabs him and plants a big kiss on his lips. She finally pulls away. Carter’s eyes are as wide as saucers. CARTER (CONT’D) What was that for? “Happy Birthday” starts playing again on Tree’s cell phone. It’s dad again.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Look, I have to run but what are you up to tonight?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Um...nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Would you like to take me out for my birthday?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Okay. What’s the punch-line?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m being serious. I know it’s kinda random but I’1l explain everything tomorrow assuming there is one. Just say yes.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yes? Tree pecks him on the cheek. As she heads off, Carter looks at Becky -- they both share confused grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree’s dad, DAVID (late 40’s, distinguished), sits in the half-empty restaurant -- an empty coffee cup in front of him. He looks at his watch with a sigh before waving the WAITRESS over to his table.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Can I pay for my coffee?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: You’re not going to eat, honey?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. Thanks. Just the check. The waitress leaves. David fishes out his wallet and removes a ten. But when he looks up, he finds Tree standing there.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Hi, daddy. Sorry I’m late. Tree takes a seat across from him. She can tell he’s hurt.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look nice. I like the tie. David looks down at his tie.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Thanks.  95. An uncomfortable silence fills the air. Tree looks down, ashamed she’s let the distance between them get this far.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’s school?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: It's fine. Dad, I don’t want to do that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You know...small talk. David looks surprised by her forthrightness.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This day...it’s so hard. I miss her so much. And I thought if I just avoided it -- and you, it’d be easier. But it’s worse. All this running and hiding has made me so unhappy. I think I finally figured it out. It took something crazy for me to get it. But I’m here and I love you and-- (she chokes up) I’m so sorry for hurting you. Tree’s dad looks visibly moved. Tree wipes her own tears away. David takes her hand and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, baby.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Thanks daddy.

dialogues.speaker: FROM ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: We SEE Tree and David engaged in conversation. Picking-up where they left off three years ago. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - EVENING We’re CLOSE ON a chef’s KNIFE as Tree slides it into the back of her jeans before hiding the handle with a tight T shirt.  96. Pulling her hair back into a pony tail, she glances at her reflection in the mirror. Her eyes say all we need to know...she’s ready to take control of her destiny. Teresa Gelbman is going to make it to Wednesday, the 19th. Even if it kills her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Lori as she comes down the hall -- she passes the nurse’s station where our hopeless romantic (the same nurse every night) has her face buried in the harlequin novel.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Deena, I’m taking my break. Back in a few. The nurse doesn’t look up. She just answers with a “K”. Lori steps into the elevator. As the doors close, we see the adjacent doors open revealing Tree. Our heroine slips by the nurse’s station. Much to her relief, she finds the OFFICER just sitting down outside Tomb’s room with his hot cup of coffee. Tree quietly approaches him. He looks up at her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Help you? Tree brings a finger to her mouth, shushing him.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (whispering) This is going to sound crazy, but Joseph Tombs is going to escape tonight.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (you crazy?) Come again?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Please. Just check on him.  97.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t know who you are, missy, but you better turn around and high-tail it out of here before I have you thrown out. He doesn’t even see it coming. Tree has the blade at his throat before the officer can get the gun from his holster.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry but you’re just gonna have to do what I say right now.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (scared) Okay. Take it easy. Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Now stand up very slowly. He does as he’s told.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: This is a real bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: So's getting killed for the sixth time. Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guiding the officer into the room, Tree’s relieved to find Tomb’s still asleep in his bed.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: See? Safe and sound. She nudges the officer closer. POLICE OFFICER (CONT’D) Look, he’s not--

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: What?!  98.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Shoot him in the head. They both don’t see Tomb’s eyes slowly open...

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Girly, you are out of your freakin’ mind! CLOSE ON -- TOMB’S ARM RESTRAINTS His wrists are just resting in them but the straps are already UNDONE.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: He’s going to kill me! Shoot him! Tombs suddenly LUNGES at the cop and shoves the knife he was hiding into the police officer’s stomach! Tree staggers back as Tombs rises from his bed. He picks up the MASK sitting on the table beside his bed. Tree grabs the fallen officer’s GUN! She aims it at Tombs and squeezes the trigger! Nothing happens!

dialogues.speaker: TOMBS
dialogues.text: The safety's still on little girl... The blood covered Tombs throws his full weight atop her! She goes down hard -- shattering a rib! The gun sails across the room from the impact! He drops the knife, climbing atop her, choking her with his bare hands!

dialogues.speaker: TOMBS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should cut off your head and be done with it... but this feels so much better, no? But this isn’t the weak and defenseless Tree who has been killed again and again. She focuses -- -- and drives her open palm hard into his nose! He cries out in pain. Tree tries to run but he grabs her by her shirt and throws her across the room! Tree hits the wall like a rag doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tombs retrieves the knife and slowly stalks over to Tree. She’s in too much pain to move. He he stands above her, the knife in the air. Tombs flashes a sadistic grin. But he’s surprised... ..-when she smiles back?! 9:23. Blackout. Moments pass. The lights come back on. He is surprised that Tree... is gone?!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Psst. No, not gone. She took advantage of the blackout to scramble a few feet away and pick up the gun.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip. .--and as he lunges at her, knife in hand... .-.-she empties the gun into his chest! Tombs falls back onto the bed, a bloody mess. DEAD. We HOLD ON Tree -- exhausted but still alive. A victim no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police have gone, the ordeal is finally over. Carter is walking Tree to her house.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So this has to be strangest birthday you've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You have no idea.  100.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Did the police say how Tombs got free?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: They really don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Like Houdini.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I guess. They stop outside her front door.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, sorry our little date didn’t happen.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It’s okay. There’s always tomorrow. Tree glances at her watch. It’s 11:53 pm.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (under her breath) I hope so. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Night. She goes inside. Carter lingers for a moment, totally smitten. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Tree’s a little surprised to find the room empty. Lori must be out with her “new man”. But she left something behind... THE CUPCAKE. Tree grabs a book of matches sitting on a box of incense. She lights the candle on the cupcake.  101. Sitting down on her bed, Tree closes her eyes. Thinking of a wish. Love? Money? Fame? Doesn’t matter. She’s alive. Tree opens her eyes and blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the flame is extinguished by Tree’s breath we are plunged into DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOWER BELL TOLLS THE HOUR...
dialogues.text: Tree’s eyes flutter open. She’s a little groggy. Pushing herself up, her eyes suddenly fill with an unspeakable horror! INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING Carter is putting something under the couch when he notices Tree sitting up in his bed. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You’re up. I wasn’t --

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Carter...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I didn’t think you’d remember my name. You were pretty wasted last night. Tree’s cell phone plays “Happy Birthday”. She grabs the phone...the caller ID says “DAD”.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No...this can’t happening! This can’t be happening! She jumps out of bed.  102.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I killed him!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Who? What are you talking about? She pulls her T-shirt off. Carter spins around. CARTER (CONT’D) You probably just had a bad dream. It happens to me whenever I drink too much. But when he turns around, Tree’s already gone. He frowns. CARTER (CONT’D) (to himself) Nice one, dickweed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears streaking down her cheeks, Tree runs past everything familiar. Nothing has changed. She’s trapped in the same day forever... INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - MORNING We can HEAR the shower running through the bathroom door as a border-line hysterical Tree enters. She immediately begins pulling clothes from her drawer and tossing them on the bed. The water stops as Lori emerges from the bathroom wrapped in a towel.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Oh. She’s finally back. Lori notices the pile of clothes building on Tree’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Going somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Yes! As far away as possible!

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?  103.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?! I’1ll tell you what’s wrong! Me! I was wrong! I thought if I stopped running I could beat it! But it’s never going to stop! So I’ll run! I’1l run to the end of the god-damn earth if I have to!

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Tree, you’re freaking me out.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Oh well! That’s me! A freak! Tree yanks the closet open, searching for something.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Tree, look... She turns around. Lori’s holding the cupcake she made for Tree.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Thanks, but I already ate it last night-- Tree freezes. Last night... She turns around to face her roommate -- her eyes locked on the cupcake.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I died in my sleep.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You...killed me. Lori slowly sets the cupcake down on Tree’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (working it out; aloud) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was poisoned. But I never ate it before. FLASH: We SEE Tree throwing the cupcake in the trash -- then dropping it on the floor after the black out.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you had to find another way. Then Tombs fell right into your lap...the perfect scapegoat. FLASH: Tombs is rolled past Lori on a gurney. She follows him with narrowed eyes as a plot is hatched in her mind.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You had access to him. Did you drug him first? FLASH: Lori jams a hypordermic needle in Tombs’ arm. While he’s unconscious, she changes him into “The Killer’s Outfit”. She puts the MASK on his face and sets the HUNTER’S KNIFE at his side. As she slips out of the room, we SEE his wrists are no longer restrained.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You knew he'd wake up and escape. Then they'd just assume he killed me. FLASH: Tree’s FIRST DEATH. The masked killer stabs her from behind.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But it was always you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH: The killer pulls-up his mask REVEALING Lori’s satisfied/hateful expression as she looks down on Tree’s lifeless body in the ditch.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO TREE'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Lori’s stunned expression yields to a sardonic laugh.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You’ve totally lost your mind. You actually think I’d try to poison you with a friggin’ cupcake?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Prove it. Tree nods to the cupcake.  105.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have a bite. Lori hesitates. Tree picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go ahead...

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You really are nuts.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll just take it to the police. I’m sure they can see what your little birthday treat is made of. Lori’s expression falls. As Tree turns, Lori grabs Tree by the hair! The cupcake falls on the desk! Lori swings Tree into the wall! Tree hits the ground, dazed. Lori slams the bedroom door shut and locks it. Blocking the door, she looks down on Tree.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: (with venom) You stupid little whore.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Why?..

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t know. Maybe because you wouldn't stop sleeping with him.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Gregory?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: But he kept choosing you over me. Guess all he really wanted was a cheap slut like you. But what I want to know is...how did you figure it out?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You’ve killed me before.  106.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Then I guess I'll just have to do it again. Tree runs for the window but Lori tackles her! She flips Tree over. Grabbing her by the hair, Lori begins BASHING her head against the floor. Suddenly, there’s a loud KNOCK at the door... Lori stops for a second and immediately covers Tree's mouth with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Everything's fine...Tree just fell. She’s okay. In her peripheral, Tree SPOTS the up-turned cupcake lying on the desk -- just an arm’s length away... Lori suddenly becomes aware of Tree grabbing the cupcake. With her other hand, Tree PUNCHES Lori in the throat! Lori gasps for air!

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Eat it, bitch! And Tree crams the cupcake into Lori’s open mouth! As Lori struggles to spit the cake out, Tree SLUGS her again, knocking Lori off. Tree gets to her feet fast. Lori rises, spitting the last bits out.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Oh, you're dead now... Looking up, Tree spies a built-in BOOKSHELF over the window where Lori is standing. With the last of her strength, Tree JUMPS UP and catches the shelf with both hands then KICKS Lori through the window!  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and wood EXPLODE as Lori sails though the window! Her body bounces off the ledge, before flipping over backwards! There’s a skull-crushing THUD as Lori hits the stone walkway two-stories below. INT. TREE’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Danielle’s door-pounding has intensified with all the commotion.

dialogues.speaker: DANIELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (winded) Lori...ate...my birthday cupcake. We can HEAR some of the sorority sister’s SCREAMS outside as Tree’s eyes roll back into her head and she passes out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a beautiful, sunny morning. Half a dozen LOCAL and NATIONAL NEWS VANS parked out front, all covering the story of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree wakes up in the hospital bed. Beside her is Carter and her dad.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What... day is it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Wednesday, you slept all night.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Wednesday? The nineteenth?  108.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: (relieved) I made it. She smiles... starts to get up, but can’t.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to move. You've been banged up pretty bad. She lets them lower her back down. CARTER (CONT’D) Do you remember anything?

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Lori? She’s dead? He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The police know everything. They found her journal. She takes Carter’s hand. Then her Dad’s. Tree is grateful. Just then, Dr. Winter appears.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: She needs her rest. You can visit her later.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I love you, too. As dad starts off, Carter steals a little kiss, adding:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You still owe me a date. Tree smiles. They leave. Alone with Dr. Winter: Tree winces.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Can I get something for the pain?  109.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WINTER
dialogues.text: In your condition, I’m afraid anything I would prescribe could be dangerous. You might need to put up with some pain for a day -- can you do that? Tree smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: I can handle one day. Believe me. Dr. Winter excuses himself. Tree closes her eyes, soaking in the sunlight of this new day, pouring through the window -- -- when she’s suddenly aware of a shadow over her. She sees the silhouette of a nurse standing over her. The woman is preparing a syringe. Tree raises her hand to try to get a look at the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: It’s for the pain. The nurse brings the syringe to the I.V. tube.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: But... the doctor said no. The nurse steps closer... It's Stephanie -- Gregory's wife.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Not your pain, Teresa. Mine. Did you think you’d get away with screwing my husband? Stephanie empties the syringe in the intravenous.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: You’ve got to be kidding me.  110. ..-whispers Tree, even as she begins to convulse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CARTER’S DORM ROOM - MORNING The bell tolls outside. Tree stirs from her slumber. She sits up...notices she’s wearing the same oversized T- shirt.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: No... She spies Carter -- bent over, in front of the couch putting something away. Tree’s eyes go wide with shock as her cell phone plays “Happy Birthday”. She grabs it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says: PRIVATE NUMBER Tree: What? Carter turns around, holding his cell phone. He laughs as he snaps it shut. Tree’s cell phone instantly stops ringing as she realizes he was just fucking with her.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think that’s funny?!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hilarious. Grabbing a pillow, Tree takes a swing and misses. Carter tackles Tree onto the bed. Pinning her down, he goes in for the kiss... But Tree suddenly pushes him back -- she looks worried. CARTER (CONT’D) What’s wrong?  111.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: What if I get stuck in this day? Carter kisses her. It’s passionate but tempered with sweetness. He pulls away. A smiles breaks through Tree’s anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: TREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess I could live with that. Tree grabs Carter’s head and pulls him into another kiss. Cue love-song that makes teenage girls prematurely ovulate as we PULL AWAY from our lovebirds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell rings one last time as the sun rises over the Potsdam University campus -- its incandescent light finally keeping its promise of tomorrow. FADE OUT.
